sen.j: 大覚寺統（だいかくじとう）は、鎌倉時代後期から南北朝時代にかけて皇位に即いた皇室の系統で、持明院統と対立していた。
sen.e: Daikakuji-to is a royal ancestry between the late Kamakura Shogunate to Nanbokucho/the Southern and Northern Court Period and used to oppsit to Jimyoin-to.

sen.j: 第88代後嵯峨天皇の子である第90代亀山天皇の子孫である。
sen.e: Daikakuji-to is descendent of the 90th Emperor KAMEYAMA, son of 88th Emperor GO-SAGA.

sen.e: Daikakuji-to is descendent of the ninetieth Emperor Kameyama, son of eighty-eighth Emperor Go-Saga.
Daikakuji-to is descendent of the ninetieth Emperor Kameyama, son of eighty-eighth Emperor Go-Saga.

sen.j: 亀山・後宇多天皇両天皇が京都の外れの嵯峨野にあった大覚寺の再興に尽力し、出家後はここに住んで院政を行った事からこの名称が付けられた。
sen.e: Both Emperor KAMEYAMA and GO-UTA put effort to reconstruct Daikaku-ji Temple in the suburb of Sagano in Kyoto, this is how the name Daikakuji-to came from, both Emperors started cloister government after they entered the priesthood.
sen.cmt: 院政 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Both Emperor Kameyama and Go-Uta put effort to reconstruct Daikaku-ji Temple in the Kyoto suburb of Sagano, which is how the name Daikakuji-to came to be, and both Emperors started cloister government after they entered the priesthood.

Both Emperor Kameyama and Go-Uta put great effort into reconstructing Daikaku-ji Temple, which was located in the suburbs of Sagano in Kyoto, and the reason Daikakuji-to was given a name based on the name of this temple was because both Emperors established a cloister government here after they entered the priesthood.
sen.cmt: "put effort" does sound unnatural but so would "put efforts," I'm afraid. I have changed it to "put great effort into" as it reads more naturally.

sen.j: 院政を敷いた後嵯峨上皇が、自分の皇子のうち後深草天皇の子孫ではなく弟の亀山天皇の子孫が皇位を継承するよう遺言して崩御したために、後深草と亀山の間で対立が起こり、鎌倉幕府により、両者の子孫の間でほぼ十年をめどに交互に皇位を継承（両統迭立）し、院政を行うよう裁定された。
sen.e: The retired Emperor GO-SAGA, who started cloister government, left a will for retired Emperor GO-FUKAKUSA's brother, Emperor KAMEYAMA's descendant (Daikakuji-to) to suceed imperial throne, this caused the conflict with each others, it was decided by the Kamakura Shougunate to share the imperial throne between ancestors from both sides for every ten years rotation (Ryoto Teiritsu) and continue to run the cloister government.
sen.cmt: 後深草天皇 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: The retired Emperor Go-Saga, who started a cloister government, left a will for the retired Emperor Go-Fukakusa's brother, Emperor Kameyama's descendant (Daikakuji-to), to succeed the Imperial Throne, thus causing a mutual conflict; it was therefore decided by the Kamakura Shougunate to share the Imperial Throne between ancestors from both sides on the basis of a ten-year rotation (Ryoto Teiritsu) and to continue running the cloister government.

The retired Emperor Go-Saga, who started a cloister government, left a will stating that among the imperial princes, the younger brother Emperor Kameyama's descendant should succeed to the Imperial Throne instead of Emperor Go-Fukakusa's descendant, thus causing a mutual conflict; it was therefore decided by the Kamakura shougunate to share the Imperial Throne between ancestors from both sides on the basis of a ten-year rotation (Ryoto Teiritsu) and to continue running the cloister government.
sen.cmt: 一部訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 後二条天皇の死後、父である後宇多上皇は「（後二条天皇の息子である）邦良親王が成人するまで」という条件で、後二条天皇の弟である後醍醐天皇に皇位を継がせようとする。
sen.e: After the death of Emperor GO-NIJO, his father Emperor GO-UTA insisted his brother Emperor GO-DAIGO to succed to the imperial throne until his son, Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi (Kuninaga) become an adult.

After the death of Emperor Go-Nijo, his father, Emperor Go-Uta, insisted that his brother, Emperor Go-Daigo, succeed to the Imperial Throne until his son, Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi (Kuninaga), reached adulthood.

After the death of Emperor Go-Nijo, his father, the retired Emperor Go-Uta, insisted that the Emperor Go-Nijo's brother, Emperor Go-Daigo, succeed to the Imperial Throne until his son, Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi (Kuninaga), reached adulthood.

sen.j: これに後宇多上皇や皇太子邦良親王が反発すると後醍醐天皇は院政を停止して対抗し、更に鎌倉幕府打倒を画策する。
sen.e: Both Emperor GO-UTA and Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi (Kuninaga) resisted this and the Emperor GO-DAIGO aborted cloister government to fight against, he even tried to bring down the Kamakura Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 鎌倉幕府 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Both Emperor Go-Uta and Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi (Kuninaga) resisted this and the Emperor Go-Daigo aborted the cloister government in order to fight against it; he even tried to bring down the Kamakura shogunate.

Both the retired Emperor Go-Uta and Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi (Kuninaga) resisted this, and the Emperor Go-Daigo aborted the cloister government in order to fight against it; he even tried to bring down the Kamakura shogunate.

sen.j: このため、大覚寺統そのものが分裂の危機を迎える。
sen.e: Due to this situation the Daikakuji-to had a crisis to breakup.
Due to this situation the Daikakuji-to had to dispel a crisis.
Due to this situation the Daikakuji-to had to dispel a crisis.

sen.j: 持明院統や鎌倉幕府は邦良親王を支援し、親王が急死するとその息子の康仁親王を持明院統の光厳天皇の皇太子に据えて後醍醐天皇系への皇位継承を拒絶する姿勢を見せるが、1333年に鎌倉幕府は滅亡し、後醍醐天皇復位によって木寺宮（後二条天皇系）の皇位継承は否認される事となった。
sen.e: Jumyoin-to and Kamakura Shogunate supand ported Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi (Kuninaga) and after his sudden death, his son Imperial Prince Yasuhito was arranged to become Emperor KOGEN's crown prince to show the rejection for Emperor GODAIGO 's line to keep the inheritance the Imperial throne, due to the closure of Kamakura shogunate Emperor GODAIGO was restored to the throne and Kidera-no-Miya's (Emperor Go-Nijo's line) enthroment did not happen.

Jumyoin-to and the Kamakura shogunate supand ported Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi (Kuninaga); after his sudden death it was arranged that his son, Imperial Prince Yasuhito, would become Emperor Kogen's crown prince in order to show the rejection of Emperor Go-Daigo 's line, which was to keep the inheritance of the Imperial Throne, but due to the closure of Kamakura shogunate Emperor Go-Daigo was restored to the throne and Kidera-no-Miya's (Emperor Go-Nijo's line) enthronement did not take place.

Jimyoin-to and the Kamakura shogunate supported Imperial Prince Kuniyoshi (Kuninaga), but after his sudden death, they arranged for his son (Imperial Prince Yasuhito) to become the crown prince for Jimyoin-to's Emperor Kogon in order to demonstrate their rejection of Emperor Go-Daigo's line. This was done to ensure the imperial succession, but due to the collapse of the Kamakura shogunate, Emperor Go-Daigo was restored to the throne and the enthronement of Kidera-no-Miya (who was of Emperor Go-Nijo's line) did not take place.
sen.cmt: 主述関係がわかりにくい。I don't think there is much that can be done to make this easier to follow if it remains as one sentence. As the sentence is so long, I have broken it in two so that the client can decide which they would prefer. Please note that I have made some other changes (such as putting "Imperial Prince Yasuhito" in parentheses) to make them read more smoothly. I have had to introduce some extra commas but I don't think a native speaker of English would have any trouble following the revised version.

sen.j: 建武の新政により、一時は皇統が大覚寺統（後醍醐天皇系）に統一されたかに見えたが、2年半にして崩壊。
sen.e: It seemed that the imperial line was unified into Daikakuji-to (Emperor GODAIGO's line) by Kemmu Restoration, however the government was collapsed in two and a half years.
It seemed that the imperial line was unified into Daikakuji-to (Emperor Go-Daigo's line) by the Kemmu Restoration; however, within two-and-a-half years the government collapsed.

sen.j: 吉野に逃れた大覚寺統の天皇（南朝）と、足利尊氏に擁立された持明院統の天皇（北朝）の対立時代＝南北朝時代となる（以後の詳細は南朝の項目を併せて参照のこと）。
sen.e: The Emperor from Daikakuji-to (the Sourthern court) escaped to Yoshino and Takauji ASHIKAGA backed up the Emperor from Jimyoin-to (the Northern court), this is how the conflict period, Nambokucho Period/the Southern and Northern Court Period started. (Please refer to to the section of Southern court for the further deatils.)

sen.e: The Emperor from Daikakuji-to (the Southern Court) escaped to Yoshino and Takauji Ashikaga backed up the Emperor from Jimyoin-to (the Northern Court), thus giving rise to a period of conflict known as the Nambokucho (Southern and Northern Court) period (refer to the section on the Southern Court for additional details).

The Emperor from Daikakuji-to (the Southern Court) escaped to Yoshino and Takauji ASHIKAGA backed up the Emperor from Jimyoin-to (the Northern Court), thus giving rise to a period of conflict known as the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (refer to the section on the Southern Court for additional details).

sen.j: 観応の擾乱の際、京都を奪回して一時的に元号を統一した（正平の一統）が、半年で崩壊する。
sen.e: At Kanno Disturbance Kyoto was recaptured and era was unified (Shohei itto) however it collapsed within half a year.
At the Kanno Disturbance, Kyoto was recaptured and the era was unified (Shohei itto), but it collapsed within half a year.

sen.j: 後に足利義満の斡旋により、正式な譲位の儀式を行うとともに今後の皇位継承については両統迭立とするという条件で、大覚寺統の後亀山天皇が三種の神器を持明院統の後小松天皇に引き渡し、南北朝の分裂は終わった（明徳の和約）。
sen.e: Later Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA helped to organize the official enthronement ceremony and there was a condition to share the Imperial Throne (Ryoto Teiritsu) in terms of succession to the imperial enthronement, Emperor GO-KAMEYAMA from Daikakuji-to gave three holy durables to Emperor KOMATSU, this was the end of division of Nanbokucho. (Meitoku treaty/Meitoku compromise)

sen.e: Later Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA helped to organize the official enthronement ceremony and there was a condition to share the Imperial Throne (Ryoto Teiritsu) in terms of succession to the imperial enthronement, Emperor GO-KAMEYAMA from Daikakuji-to gave three holy durables to Emperor KOMATSU, this was the end of division of Nanbokucho. (Meitoku treaty/Meitoku compromise)

Later, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA helped organize the official enthronement ceremony and there was a condition for sharing the Imperial Throne (Ryoto Teiritsu); in terms of succession to the imperial enthronement, Emperor GO-KAMEYAMA from Daikakuji-to gave three holy durables to Emperor KOMATSU, thus marking the end of the division of the Northern and Southern Courts (the Meitoku Treaty or Meitoku Compromise).

sen.j: しかし南朝方の入京にあたって神器帰還の儀式は行われたものの正式な譲位の儀式は行われず、後亀山天皇への処遇は「天皇として即位はしていないが特例として上皇待遇」というものであった。
sen.e: Although there was an official ceremony to return holy durables to Nancho (the Southern court), there was no enthronement ceremony and the Emperor GO-KAMEYAMA was treated as 'a special retired Emperor who is not officially enthroned'.

sen.j: そして以後の皇位が持明院統だけで継承されたため、大覚寺統の子孫は不満を抱き、南朝の遺臣が宮中の神器を奪取して立てこもるなどの抵抗を15世紀半ばまで続けた（後南朝）。
sen.e: Since then succession to the imperial enthronement was kept only from Jimyoin-to side and the ancestors of Daikakuji-to complained about this, there was one occasion when surviving retainer from Nancho (the Southern court) stole the holy durables from the palace and barricade himself, this kind of incident continued to happen until middle of fifteen century. (Second Southern Court)

Since then succession to the imperial enthronement was kept only from Jimyoin-to side and the ancestors of Daikakuji-to complained about this, there was one occasion when surviving retainer from Nancho (the Southern court) stole the holy durables from the palace and barricade himself, this kind of incident continued to happen until middle of fifteen century. (Second Southern Court)

Subsequently, succession to the Imperial Throne was kept only from the Jimyoin-to side, and the ancestors of Daikakuji-to complained about this; on one occasion a surviving retainer from Nancho (the Southern Court) stole the holy durables from the palace and barricaded himself, and incidents of this sort continued to occur until the mid-fifteenth century (Second Southern Court).
